versions.noVersions: To update OpenIDM, download the desired binary (in zip format), and copy it to the openidm/bin/update directory.
versions.cli1: You may update a clustered instance only via the CLI.  Read more
versions.description: You can update OpenIDM with one of the binaries found in the openidm/bin/update/ directory.
versions.error: Resolve errors then restart the update process
versions.enableMaintenanceModeDesc: When you confirm, OpenIDM allows running jobs to finish. Scheduled jobs are paused and OpenIDM goes into maintenance mode.

maintenanceMode.noJobs: All scheduled jobs complete, scheduler is shut down.

preview.description: Review files to be replaced below. OpenIDM will save customized files for future access.
preview.noFiles: There are no files to preview
preview.errorInitiatingUpdate: Update error: failed to start update

UNEXPECTED.desc: Existing file not from the original installation

NONEXISTENT.desc: The file does not exist on disk nor in the list of known files for the original distribution.

DELETED.desc: OpenIDM reinstalls this file during the update

DIFFERS.desc: OpenIDM backs up the modified file during the update.

PRESERVED.desc: OpenIDM reinstalls this customized file during the update.

install.details: When OpenIDM restarts, you'll see the full report.
install.reverted: There was an error updating, your copy of IDM has been reverted.
install.failedStatus: Failed to get the status of the install with id:

review.noFilesError: There are no files to report on.
review.successMsg: You have successfully updated OpenIDM to version
review.desc: All files were successfully installed. Modified files were backed up to locations specified below.  You will need to refresh your browser to see any UI changes.

PRESERVED.desc: Modified file saved; updated file available in same directory.

APPLIED.desc: Patch applied to configuration file. Backup not made.

google.listHeader: You must grant this project access to all of the following APIs:
google.callbackUrlMessage: Be sure your project is configured to use this callback URL
google.needHelp: Need help locating your client ID and secret?
google.changeHeader: Note for new and recently-changed projects
google.changeDetails: When you create a new project in Google, it can take up to 24 hours for the data to be propagated through Google. If you are setting up OpenIDM with a project that you have just created, or if you have recently changed the Callback URL of your project, you might receive an error when you attempt to validate the client ID and secret.

salesforce.callbackUrlMessage: Your application must be configured to use this Callback URL
salesforce.listHeader: You must grant this application all of the following OAuth Scopes:
salesforce.listItemThree: Perform requests on your behalf at any time
salesforce.changeHeader: Note for new and recently-changed applications
salesforce.changeDetails: When you create a new Connected App, or update your Connected App in Salesforce, it takes some time (at least five minutes) for the data to be propagated through all the Salesforce servers. If you are setting up OpenIDM with a Connected App that you have just created, or if you have recently changed the Callback URL of your Connected App, you might receive an error when you attempt to validate the consumer key and consumer secret. You should therefore wait at least five minutes after creating or updating your Connected App before you attempt to set up OpenIDM with that App.
salesforce.needHelpKey: Need help locating your consumer key and secret?

mapping.validLinkQualifierScript: Requires a valid Link Qualifier script.
mapping.linkQualifierNotArray: Valid Link Qualifier must be an array.
mapping.badScript: Invalid; a Link Qualifier script must return an array of strings
mapping.uniqueLinkQualifiers: The link qualifier must be unique.
mapping.createMappingMessage: Click this button to create a mapping between these two sources.
mapping.saveMappingMessage: Please enter a unique mapping name.
mapping.confirmDeleteMapping:
Are you sure you want to delete the "__mappingName__" mapping?

**Caution: this action cannot be reversed.
mapping.confirmRemoveProperty: Are you sure you want to remove the "__property__" property mapping?
mapping.transformRequiredForMulti: A transformation script is required when mapping from a multiple-value source to a single-value target.
mapping.validPropertyRequired: You must select a valid property name.
mapping.invalidScript: You cannot save a transformation script that contains errors.
mapping.invalidConditionScript: You cannot save a condition script that contains errors.
mapping.mappingExists: Mapping for this target property already exists.
mapping.roleEntitlementsDescription: View role entitlements assigned to this mapping.

propertyEdit.title: Target Property: __property__
propertyEdit.valuePrecedenceNote: Since the values mapped might result in multiple values, sort them here to establish which should take precedence (the first value matched will be used).
propertyEdit.propertyListLabel: Enter or select the source property; clear the text box to use the complete object.
propertyEdit.transformationSciptLabel: Enter a transformation script for complex properties.
propertyEdit.conditionSciptLabel: Enter a conditional update script for
propertyEdit.defaultValuesLabel: Set a default value for this property mapping.
propertyEdit.transformScriptNote:
Use JavaScript code above to perform advanced mapping operations.
This script will be processed for each source object that is mapped, to calculate its value for this property.
The result of the final statement in the script will be used as the value for this property.
This script has the "source" variable available to it as input.
The value for the "source" variable depends on how you have defined the attribute mapping in the "Attribute List" tab.
If you haven't selected any value in the "Property List" tab, then "source" will be the complete source object with properties for each directory property.
If you have selected a value in "Property List", then "source" will be that value.
propertyEdit.conditionScriptNote:
Use JavaScript code above to prevent target data from being updated in certain conditions.
This script will be processed for each source object that is mapped.
If the result is true or if there is no script the property will be updated, otherwise updates will not be sent to the target.
This script has the "object" variable available to it as a global.
The "object" variable represents the complete source record with properties for each source property mapping.

analysis.clickToAnalyze: to start analyzing relationships between Source and Target data.
analysis.newLinkCreated: New link created. No changes until after the next reconciliation.
analysis.newLinksWarning: __count__ records have changed since last Reconciliation.

analysis.forResultsToTakeEffect: for the result of these changes to take effect.

reconAnalysis.ambiguousMessage: Source object correlates to multiple target objects, without a link.
reconAnalysis.missingMessage: The source links to a missing target object.
reconAnalysis.foundAlreadyLinkedMessage: Correlation from source points to a target object already linked to a different source.
reconAnalysis.unqualifiedMessage: Source object not qualified, but target objects found.
reconAnalysis.allGoneMessage: Source object removed, link not found, correlation not possible.
reconAnalysis.linkOnlyMessage: Link found, target object not found.
reconAnalysis.confirmedMessage: Valid source and target objects linked.
reconAnalysis.foundMessage: Correlation query from source points to one target object.
reconAnalysis.absentMessage: Source object has no matching target.

name.help: Name of the audit event handler

topics.help: List of topics handled by an audit event handler

enabled.help: Enables or disables an audit event handler

logDirectory.help: Directory in which to store audit log CSV files

quoteChar.help: Character to append and prepend to a CSV field

endOfLineSymbols.help: Characters that mark the end of a line

enabled.help: Enables the CSV tamper evident feature

keyStoreHandlerName.help: Name of the keystore to use for tamper-evident logging

autoFlush.help: If enabled, does not flush after each event (so improves performance)

databaseType.help: Identifies the database in use (MySQL, Oracle SQL)

dataSourceClassName.help: Fully qualified JDBC driver class name

autoCommit.help: Enables or disables automatic committing of changes to the database

connectionTimeout.help: Max wait time before failing the connection attempt

idleTimeout.help: Max idle time before the connection is closed

maxLifetime.help: The maximum time a JDBC connection can be open

minIdle.help: Minimum number of idle connections in the connection pool

maxPoolSize.help: Maximum number of connections in the connection pool

driverClassName.help: Fully qualified JDBC driver class name

fieldToColumn.help: Mapping of audit event topic fields to database table fields

enabled.help: Enables or disables audit event buffering

autoFlush.help: If enabled, does not flush after each event (so improves performance)

writerThreads.help: Number of threads used to write the buffered events

interval.help: Interval at which buffered events are written to the database

maxBatchedEvents.help: Maximum number of batched statements the database can support per connection

host.help: Host name or IP address of receiving syslog server

port.help: Port number of receiving syslog server

connectTimeout.help: Timeout for connecting to syslog server (seconds)

facility.help: Syslog facility value to apply to all events

severityFieldMappings.help: Defaults to INFORMATIONAL if no mapping is defined

valueMappings.help: Mapping of event values to Syslog SEVERITY values

enabled.help: Enables or disables audit event buffering

minFreeSpaceRequired.help: Minimum amount of disk space required on the system where audit files are stored

rotationFilePrefix.help: Prefix to prepend to audit files when rotating audit files

maxDiskSpaceToUse.help: The maximum amount of disk space the audit files can occupy

rotationTimes.help: Durations after midnight to trigger file rotation

rotationInterval.help: Interval to trigger audit file rotations

rotationEnabled.help: Enables and disables audit file rotation

rotationFileSuffix.help: Suffix to append to audit files when they are rotated. Suffix should be a timestamp

maxFileSize.help: Maximum size an audit file can grow to, before rotation is triggered

maxNumberOfHistoryFiles.help: Maximum number of backup audit files allowed

rotationRetentionCheckInterval.help: Interval for periodically checking file rotation and retention policies

useSSL.help: Use SSL/TLS to connect to Elasticsearch

host.help: Hostname or IP address of Elasticsearch (default: localhost)

username.help: Username when Basic Authentication is enabled via Elasticsearch Shield

password.help: Password when Basic Authentication is enabled via Elasticsearch Shield

indexName.help: Index Name (default: audit) for events. Change if 'audit' conflicts with an existing Elasticsearch index

buffering.help: Configuration for buffering events and sending in batches (increases write-throughput)

maxSize.help: Fixed maximum number of events that can be buffered (default: 10000)

writeInterval.help: Interval (default: 1 s) at which buffered events are written to Elasticsearch (units of 'ms' or 's' are recommended)

maxBatchedEvents.help: Maximum number of events per batch-write to Elasticsearch for each Write Interval (default: 500)

deliveryMode.help: JMS mode to deliver the messages in, either PERSISTENT or NON_PERSISTENT

sessionMode.help: JMS session acknowledgement mode: AUTO, CLIENT, or DUPS_OK

batch.help: Batch configuration settings to be utilized if batch is enabled

batchEnabled.help: Boolean for batch delivery of audit events

capacity.help: Maximum event count in the batch queue; additional events are dropped

threadCount.help: Number of concurrent threads that pull events from the batch queue

maxBatchedEvents.help: Maximum number of events per batch

insertTimeoutSec.help: Waiting period (seconds) for available capacity, when a new event enters the queue

pollTimeoutSec.help: Worker thread waiting period (seconds) for the next event, before going idle

shutdownTimeoutSec.help: Application waiting period (seconds) for worker thread termination

contextProperties.help: Settings to populate the JNDI initial context with

topicName.help: JNDI lookup name for the JMS topic

connectionFactoryName.help: JNDI lookup name for the JMS connection factory

policies.help: Create policies to filter parts of an audit event

include.help: A list of fields (JSON pointers) to include in the audit event

exclude.help: A list of fields (JSON pointers) to exclude from the audit event
